alert.note: Alert for Catawba; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL CATAWBA AND CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Lincolnton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincolnton, Newton, Maiden, Boger City, Iron Station, Crouse, Vale, and Startown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
